featured.text: When the hungry traveler saw the precious stone, he asked her to give it to him.
They construct their colonies on precious farmland, invading crops while searching for insects underground.
The fees are always the same, no matter how precious the data on the disk is.
When it rains, a thin layer of fresh water forms on top of the ocean, providing the snakes with a fleeting opportunity to lap up that precious resource.
When he found her, he said, “I know how valuable this stone is, but I’m giving it back to you, 24 that you can give me something even more precious.

other.text: A human body usually has a ________ temperature of about 37 degrees C. (A) steady (B) various (C) gradual (D) precious 8.

definition.en_def: Of great value; not to be wasted or treated carelessly.
definition.example: She wore a precious necklace that had been passed down through generations.
